Posts.Content: Thanks for replying tina.My wife had a mastcecomy and reconstruction from her tummy in 1998 had alot of complications but everything turned out ok.in 2005 her consultant was doing some research and elaine was one of her ladies asked to take part ,as a result of this Elaine told them that she felt unbalanced ,her consultant agreed and she had a reduction and as a matter of course sent the tissue to the path lab for checking and they found that the cancer had returned.Elaine asked for scans and they found that she had a 6 cm tumour in the liver and at that time they could not do anything except keep her well for as long as possibly.a year later she was operated on and had the tumour removed .Elaine has had two lots of chemo also hormone tablets.Last oct she started to have right hip pain which after test have led then to think that it is in her bones just waiting for a MRI scan to confirm it and to see what the plan of treatment is .All the time she has had her cancer she has been very positive.We both know that she would never be rid of the cancer .But this time she is more down than before.Elaine will be 47 this July and we celevrate our silver wedding this Sept ,we have booked to go on an Alaskan cruise.Thank you for your kind words and hope everything goes well with you
Posts.Title: breast cancer that has led to bone cancer

Posts.Content: My wife Elaine collapsed at early hours of last Wed morning taken to hospital and had a ct scan of her brain on friday morning and we have been tol that she has a brain tumour in her right temporal lobe and Elaine has now been refered to the neurologist but we don`t see him for another week. will keep updating on what is happening stuart
Posts.Title: breast cancer that has led to bone cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Les thanks for your kind words .My wife was admitted to hospital on Wed morning and had a ct scan today which has revealed that she has a tumour in the brain we are now being reffered to another hospital that specialises in neurologly Stuart
Posts.Title: breast cancer that has led to bone cancer

Posts.Content: My wife first diagnosed in 1998 had mascetomy and reconstuction,came back in 205 but also in liver had another mascetomy and reconstuction.in 2007 had tumor removed from liver.two weeks ago we were told that the cancer is highly likely to now be in the bones.would like to know if anyone is in similar position.stuart
